Interface FileHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
DataFileHandler
public interface FileHandler
The FileHandler interface defines the methods, that can be accessed from the concrete handler implementations. The interface defines all the needed methods, needed for handling reading and writing files.

    Method

    Closes the currently loaded file.

  • Method Details

    • readFile

      GameProcessor readFile(File file)
      Loads the file contents and returns the loaded game instance
      Parameters:
      file - The file that is going to be read from.
      Returns:
      Loaded game instance

    • newFile

      void newFile(File file)
      Creates a new file, that is loaded in the program
      Parameters:
      file - The file, that is going to be created.

    • closeFile

      void closeFile()
      Closes the currently loaded file.

    • saveFile

      void saveFile(GameProcessor game)
      Saves the given game instance in the currently loaded file.
      Parameters:
      game - The game instance, that needs to be saved.

    • saveAsFile

      void saveAsFile(File file, GameProcessor game)
      Saves the given game instance in the targeted file.
      Parameters:
      file - The targeted file, where the game instance is going to be saved
      game - The game instance, that needs to be saved.

    • isFileLoaded

      boolean isFileLoaded()
      Shows if a file is currently loaded.
      Returns:
      Boolean, that represents if a files is currently loaded.
